definition[0]: someone who deals with complaints made by ordinary people against the government, banks, insurance companies etc
definition[1]: someone who deals with complaints made by the public against government departments, banks, insurance companies etc. In Britain, the main government ombudsman is called the Parliamentary Commissioner for Administration
example[0]: You can apply to the Banking Ombudsman for arbitration.
example[1]: Customers have the right to ask the Insurance Ombudsman to review their complaint.
